@graph.name: Candied Lime, almond, coconut cookies. Vegan. - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Candied Lime, Almond and Coconut Cookies. Absolutely delicious, chewy cookies that make a great snack or sweet treat. Vegan Recipe.

itemListElement.name: Candied Lime, almond, coconut cookies. Vegan.

@graph.name: Candied Lime Almond Coconut Cookies, Vegan.
@graph.description: Candied Lime, Almond and Coconut Cookies. Absolutely delicious, chewy cookies that make a great snack or sweet treat. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 4 Tablespoon raw sugar or jaggery or any sweetener that can caramelize a bit
2 Tablespoons Raw turbinado sugar or coconut sugar or jaggery or sweetener of choice ((I used 1 Tbsp for mild sweetness))
3 -4 Tablespoons sweet syrup ((from the candied lime))
1 Tablespoon vegan butter or organic canola oil
2 Tablespoons oat flour ((Bobâ€™s Red Mill Organic Old Fashioned))
1/2 - 2/3 cup self rising flour or all purpose + 1/4 tsp baking powder

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, add a cup (235ml) of water and bring to a boil. Add the sugar, and mix well. Simmer for 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, add a cup (235ml) of water and bring to a boil. Add the sugar, and mix well. Simmer for 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the sliced lime and cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes or until the syrup thickens and starts to bubble up.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the sliced lime and cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes or until the syrup thickens and starts to bubble up.

recipeInstructions.text: I got about 5-6 Tablespoons of thick syrup with lime slices in it. You can remove the lime slices and coat them with powdered sugar and keep refrigerated for a few weeks. I chopped up the slices into small pieces and left them in the syrup, since I was going to use them within the next few days.
recipeInstructions.name: I got about 5-6 Tablespoons of thick syrup with lime slices in it. You can remove the lime slices and coat them with powdered sugar and keep refrigerated for a few weeks. I chopped up the slices into small pieces and left them in the syrup, since I was going to use them within the next few days.

recipeInstructions.text: I used 3-4 Tablespoons of the syrup in the cookies and The remaining syrup went in some multigrain pancakes, which turned out an amazing. fluffy and limey! My multigrain pancake recipe here.
recipeInstructions.name: I used 3-4 Tablespoons of the syrup in the cookies and The remaining syrup went in some multigrain pancakes, which turned out an amazing. fluffy and limey! My multigrain pancake recipe here.

itemListElement.text: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.
itemListElement.name: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.

itemListElement.text: Add in the room temperature vegan butter, coconut oil, sugar and lime syrup and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light.
itemListElement.name: Add in the room temperature vegan butter, coconut oil, sugar and lime syrup and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light.

itemListElement.text: Blend/grind the almonds and oats to a coarse flour along with the baking powder and keep aside.
itemListElement.name: Blend/grind the almonds and oats to a coarse flour along with the baking powder and keep aside.

itemListElement.text: To the oil and sugar mix, add in the ground almonds, ground oats, coconut flakes, salt, self rising flour, candied lime pieces and mix till just about combined. Add in more flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency. Keep this mixture more flowy and gooey, more like a thick batter and unlike the oat cookie dough, where the mixture is slightly stiff.
itemListElement.name: To the oil and sugar mix, add in the ground almonds, ground oats, coconut flakes, salt, self rising flour, candied lime pieces and mix till just about combined. Add in more flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency. Keep this mixture more flowy and gooey, more like a thick batter and unlike the oat cookie dough, where the mixture is slightly stiff.

itemListElement.text: Oil a spoon and pick up tablespoon full batter-y dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better. Shape with oiled hands.
itemListElement.name: Oil a spoon and pick up tablespoon full batter-y dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better. Shape with oiled hands.

itemListElement.text: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 11-14 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should not be runny or liquidy when done and just about starting to brown on the edges.
itemListElement.name: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 11-14 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should not be runny or liquidy when done and just about starting to brown on the edges.

itemListElement.text: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes if you can:)
itemListElement.name: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes if you can:)

itemListElement.text: Store in airtight container for a week or so. You can use lemons to make these candied lemon cookies, since lime is more citrusy and strong sometimes bitter flavored compared to lemons. Another way To reduce bitteryness, substitute the lime syrup with maple or agave.
itemListElement.name: Store in airtight container for a week or so. You can use lemons to make these candied lemon cookies, since lime is more citrusy and strong sometimes bitter flavored compared to lemons. Another way To reduce bitteryness, substitute the lime syrup with maple or agave.
